how do you get a job at Google mm-hmm
what does it take what is Google looking
for well so there's four things we look
for in every candidate and the four
things are number one general cognitive
ability so and it's not just smarts but
it's problem-solving and curiosity and
ability to learn you're much better off
hiring somebody who can learn than
somebody who necessarily actually knows
what they're doing the main thing we
look for is intellectual aptitude and
learning ability second most important
thing we look for is what we call
emergent leadership when we think about
leadership at Google we instead think
about people who are willing to step in
when there's a difficult problem and
just as importantly step out when
there's not a need for their expertise
the third thing is cultural fit when we
talk about cultural fit at Google what
we look for our people who are
comfortable with ambiguity because we're
pretty chaotic messy environment on the
inside we look for people who are highly
conscientious because if you have a
chaotic environment you want people who
are gonna say you know oh look though
the water bottle needs to be changed
because you have a new person coming
onstage and you don't want them drinking
somebody else's backwash and the last
thing is actual expertise and for the
technical roles in the company which
make up about half the company you
actually have to be quite good at
engineering you have to be great at it
for the other roles though we take a
portfolio approach where we believe for
most of our jobs we don't actually need
you to have deep expertise on what
you're going to do because again if you
hire people who are able to learn and
who are conscientious they'll take
something and figure out how to do it
